summary: Email correspondence between the U.S. Attorney's Office and JPMorgan regarding subpoenas related to the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The email discusses coordination of document production in response to the subpoenas.

persons.name: Steven L D'Alessandro
persons.context: JPMorgan employee who communicated with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding subpoenas related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jennifer L Buentello
persons.context: JPMorgan employee identified as handling the subpoena requests from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: David E Swarts
persons.context: JPMorgan employee copied on the email correspondence regarding the Epstein/Maxwell subpoenas.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject of the investigation for which subpoenas were issued to JPMorgan.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a subject of the investigation for which subpoenas were issued to JPMorgan.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects of the same investigation, indicating they are linked in the legal proceedings.
Work together at JPMorgan coordinating responses to subpoenas from the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Both are JPMorgan employees copied on the email correspondence regarding the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

events.title: Phone conversation regarding subpoenas
events.description: Steven D'Alessandro of JPMorgan spoke with someone from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding subpoenas related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Email follow-up on subpoena coordination
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sent a follow-up email to JPMorgan regarding the coordination of responses to subpoenas for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

keyFacts: JPMorgan was served with subpoenas from the U.S. Attorney's Office as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The document shows active coordination between JPMorgan's legal/compliance team and federal prosecutors in August 2019 regarding document production.
Jennifer Buentello was specifically identified as the JPMorgan employee handling the subpoena requests.
The investigation involved collecting materials related to both Epstein and Maxwell from financial institutions.
The correspondence indicates the investigation was ongoing and active in August 2019, shortly after Epstein's death.
